title: Woman, 20, died 'after boyfriend staged road race with pal and smashed into lamppost'
text:

A young woman was killed in an 80mph crash when her boyfriend staged a road race with his friend through the streets, a court was told

Sophie Brimble, 20, was a front seat passenger when her boyfriend Jay Bayliss lost control and smashed into a lamppost.

A court heard Bayliss, 25, was racing at high speeds with his friend Neil Brooks, 49, through 30mph residential streets.

Prosecutor Matthew Cobbe said: "It was one driver egging the other on.

"It was this race that led to the collision which led to the death of Miss Brimble."

(Image: WALES NEWS SERVICE)

Mr Cobbe said the pair were driving at more than double the 30mph speed limit in the minutes before the fatal smash.

He said: "Mr Bayliss was travelling way above the speed limit in the lead up to the collision.

"He had been driving at excessive speed through a residential area in excess of 80mph.

"Mr Bayliss lost control, his car began to rotate and it slid towards a metal lamppost. The result was a catastrophe."

Sophie was killed in the collision in Brynmawr, South Wales, and Bayliss was so severely injured he was not fit to be charged over her death.

(Image: WALES NEWS SERVICE)

Brooks is standing trial at Cardiff Crown Court accused of causing Sophie's death by dangerous driving.

The court heard Brooks knew Bayliss and Miss Brimble and allegedly instigated the race when he recognised Bayliss' VW Polo.

Mr Cobbe said: "Mr Bayliss was not solely responsible for the collision.

"Mr Bayliss was driving at excessive speed because he had got himself involved in an impromptu race with Mr Brooks.

"It is a race that started about half a mile prior to the collision."

Mr Cobbe said "aggressive" driving by Bayliss and Brooks in their VW Polo and VW Bora "deteriorated into the impromptu race that in turn caused the catastrophic collision."

(Image: WALES NEWS SERVICE)

He said: "They both then drove at high speed along that road, having little or no regard to their excessive speed of the fact that it was through a residential area.

"They pushed their vehicles hard through this residential area, both of them reaching speeds in excess of 80mph, their focus now on their race.”

But the court heard Bayliss crashed into a metal lamppost and Sophie, of Crickhowell, Powys, died in July 2017.

Mr Cobbe said Bayliss and Brooks "share responsibility" for Sophie's death.

Brooks, of Ebbw Vale, denies causing death by dangerous driving and serious injury by dangerous driving.

The trial continues.
description: Sophie Brimble was a front seat passenger when the car crashed at 80mph and smashed into a lamppost, in Brynmawr, South Wales
